<ce:section-title>The synthesis of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>
</ce:section-title><ce:para view="all">The title compound <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> was hydrothermally synthesized under autogenous pressure. An aqueous mixture (8 ml) containing ZnCl<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> (0.136 g), 1,2,4,5-benzenetetracarboxylic acid (0.254 g), piperazine (0.086 g), and NaOH (0.16 g) was adjusted to pH 9.0 with 1 M NaOH aqueous under continuous stirring and then sealed in a Parr Teflon-lined stainless steel vessel (15 ml), which was heated to 180 °C for 72 h. After slowly cooling at 10 °C·h<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup> to ambient temperature, yellow block-like crystals of compound <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> Zn<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(btec)(pipz)(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O) were mechanically separated from the white powder and washed by distilled water (Yield: ca. 70% based on Zn). Elemental analyses results of the yellow crystals are consistent with the stoichiometry of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>. Calc. for C<ce:inf loc="post">14</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">14</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">9</ce:inf>Zn<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>): C, 34.6; H, 2.9; N, 5.8; Zn, 27.0. Found: C, 34.5; H, 2.8; N, 5.9; Zn, 26.8%. FT/IR data (cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3263(m), 3178(s), 3034(w), 2990(w), 2880(w), 1623(s), 1565(s), 1491(s), 1467(w), 1451(w), 1432(m), 1405(m), 1380(w), 1359(s), 1326(m), 1280(w), 1225(s), 1185(m), 1137(s), 1108(w), 1089(m), 1048(m), 1013(s), 942(m), 919(m), 888(s), 876(m), 867(w), 836(w), 821(m), 810(m), 765(s), 628(w), 585(m), 545(m), 486(w), 464(m), 420(m).</ce:para>
clean_text:
The synthesis of 1 

The title compound 1 was hydrothermally synthesized under autogenous pressure. An aqueous mixture (8 ml) containing ZnCl2 (0.136 g), 1,2,4,5-benzenetetracarboxylic acid (0.254 g), piperazine (0.086 g), and NaOH (0.16 g) was adjusted to pH 9.0 with 1 M NaOH aqueous under continuous stirring and then sealed in a Parr Teflon-lined stainless steel vessel (15 ml), which was heated to 180 °C for 72 h. After slowly cooling at 10 °C⋅h-1 to ambient temperature, yellow block-like crystals of compound 1 Zn2(btec)(pipz)(H2O) were mechanically separated from the white powder and washed by distilled water (Yield: ca. 70% based on Zn). Elemental analyses results of the yellow crystals are consistent with the stoichiometry of 1. Calc. for C14H14N2O9Zn2 (1): C, 34.6; H, 2.9; N, 5.8; Zn, 27.0. Found: C, 34.5; H, 2.8; N, 5.9; Zn, 26.8%. FT/IR data (cm-1): 3263(m), 3178(s), 3034(w), 2990(w), 2880(w), 1623(s), 1565(s), 1491(s), 1467(w), 1451(w), 1432(m), 1405(m), 1380(w), 1359(s), 1326(m), 1280(w), 1225(s), 1185(m), 1137(s), 1108(w), 1089(m), 1048(m), 1013(s), 942(m), 919(m), 888(s), 876(m), 867(w), 836(w), 821(m), 810(m), 765(s), 628(w), 585(m), 545(m), 486(w), 464(m), 420(m).
